title: Ubuntu
summary: Ubuntu (/ʊˈbʊntuː/ (listen) uu-BUUN-too)[6] (Stylized as ubuntu) is a Linux distribution based on Debian and composed mostly of free and open-source software.[7][8][9] Ubuntu is officially released in three editions: Desktop,[10] Server,[11] and Core[12] for Internet of things devices[13] and robots.[14][15] All the editions can run on the computer alone, or in a virtual machine.[16] Ubuntu is a popular operating system for cloud computing, with support for OpenStack.[17] Ubuntu's default desktop has been GNOME, since version 17.10.[18]
